intro: Stenactis delphiniifolia, commonly known as the Delphiniifolia stenactis, is a flowering plant native to specific regions in Africa. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically features narrow, lance-shaped leaves that are arranged alternately along the stem. Its flowers are usually small and clustered, with a distinctive coloration that varies depending on the species. Stenactis delphiniifolia is often found in rocky or arid environments, adapting to harsh conditions with its drought-resistant properties.
